publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-780 Tommy Sheridan: Law Commission Evidence—That the Parliament notes with concern the decision of the Law Commission to refuse access to the evidence submitted to its enquiry on poindings and warrant sales; believes that this is contrary to the spirit of the Freedom of Information Bill published by the Executive, and agrees that the evidence submitted should be made freely available to the Parliament immediately.

S1M-780 Tommy Sheridan: Law Commission Evidence—That the Parliament notes with concern the decision of the Law Commission to refuse access to the evidence submitted to its enquiry on poindings and warrant sales; believes that this is contrary to the spirit of the Freedom of Information Bill published by the Executive, and agrees that the evidence submitted should be made freely available to the Parliament immediately.
S1M-780# Law Commission Evidence (lodged on 26 April 2000) Michael Russell*
S1M-780# Law Commission Evidence (lodged on 26 April 2000) Shona Robison*, Alex Neil*
S1M-780# Law Commission Evidence (lodged on 26 April 2000) Robin Harper*

S1M-780# Tommy Sheridan: Law Commission Evidence—That the Parliament notes with concern the decision of the Law Commission to refuse access to the evidence submitted to its enquiry on poindings and warrant sales; believes that this is contrary to the spirit of the Freedom of Information Bill published by the Executive, and agrees that the evidence submitted should be made freely available to the Parliament immediately. Supported by: Michael Russell, Shona Robison, Alex Neil, Robin Harper

Supported by: Michael Russell, Shona Robison, Alex Neil, Robin Harper, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr John McAllion, Andrew Wilson, Mr Gil Paterson*
